Web Visualization API¶

web_visualization.main(county='all_counties', time_start='2020-01-01', time_end='2020-11-10')¶

reads data from a .csv file and generates a labeled,3 nice plot of date vs. ”number of reported cases” or date vs. ”cumulative number of cases”.

Parameters

  • county (str, optional) – the county to show plot for.

  • time_start (str, optional) – start date

  • time_end (str, optional) – end date

Returns

DataFrame that contains information of the given time frame

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

web_visualization.plot_both(county='all_counties', time_start='2020-01-01', time_end='2020-11-10', aggr='layer')¶

displaying Number of reported cases and Cumulative number of cases in one plot

Parameters

  • county (str, optional) – the county to show plot for.

  • time_start (str, optional) – start date

  • time_end (str, optional) – end date

Returns

altair Chart

Return type

altair.vegalite.v4.api.LayerChart

web_visualization.plot_cumulative_cases(county='all_counties', time_start='2020-01-01', time_end='2020-11-10')¶

plot a line plot which shows cumulative number of reported cases of covid-19 vs date.

Parameters

  • county (str, optional) – the county to show plot for.

  • time_start (str, optional) – start date

  • time_end (str, optional) – end date

Returns

altair Chart

Return type

altair.vegalite.v4.api.LayerChart

web_visualization.plot_reported_cases(county='all_counties', time_start='2020-01-01', time_end='2020-11-10')¶

plot a bar plot which shows number of reported new cases of covid-19 vs date.

Parameters

  • county (str, optional) – the county to show plot for.

  • time_start (str, optional) – start date

  • time_end (str, optional) – end date

Returns

altair Chart

Return type

altair.vegalite.v4.api.LayerChart

assignment6
